p: The growth of the food discipline is quantified in Fig. 1b, c as the aggregate number of publications containing the keywords “food” and “oil” and “nanoencapsulation,” “nanoemulsion,” “nanoparticle,” or “nanotechnology” in their abstract; the information is shown as a function of the publishing year. As indicated by the trends in Fig. 1, most of the growth in the food nanotechnology field took place after the year 2010 because of the numerous nanotechnology studies of the late nineties and the growth of food-grade additives suitable for the nanoparticle process.
